perturbation.original_text: "Direct Access Storage" or "DAS" means data storage devices that are directly attached to a server.
perturbation.changed_text: "Direct Access Storage" or "DAS" means data storage devices that are directly attached to a server. "Local Storage" has the same definition as Direct Access Storage
perturbation.explanation: The document defines 'Local Storage' as having the same meaning as 'Direct Access Storage' in one section. It might lead to confusion, as in other systems 'Local Storage' can mean storage directly on a user's computer and not on a server. Also the redundancy in definition is misleading.

perturbation.original_text: The account support representative will: notify Customer of planned or emergency e-business Hosting Center maintenance; assist with change requests; and be available to assist Customer with questions and issues during normal business hours for the e-business Hosting Center (Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m., excluding national holidays).
perturbation.changed_text: The account support representative will: notify Client of planned or emergency e-business Hosting Center maintenance; assist with change requests; and be available to assist Client with questions and issues during normal business hours for the e-business Hosting Center (Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. - 6:00 p.m., excluding national holidays).
perturbation.explanation: The contract refers to 'Customer' and 'Client' interchangeably without defining if they refer to the same entity. In the definition of Customer, it is defined as IBM's Customer, so calling it Client leads to contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: Outages caused by Customer Content or Customer initiated patches; Outages caused by Customer not approving applying IBM recommended OS patches; Outages caused by the Customer not approving applying of OS maintenance releases; Periods where the Customer may have been granted System Administration rights;
perturbation.changed_text: Outages caused by User Content or User initiated patches; Outages caused by User not approving applying IBM recommended OS patches; Outages caused by the User not approving applying of OS maintenance releases; Periods where the User may have been granted System Administration rights;
perturbation.explanation: The contract refers to 'Customer' and 'User' interchangeably without defining if they refer to the same entity. Given the formal context, 'User' is unusual.
